author: mikemaccana
body:
## PR Summary

A modern version of the traditional Unix Rosetta Stone, which is maintained, includes Powershell, and has more detail than the table below.

## PR Checklist

Note: Please mark anything not applicable to this PR `NA`.

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [x] Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [`NA`] User facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [`NA`] Issue filed - Issue link:
- [x] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [`NA`] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
    - [`NA`] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)
- [ ] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: @TravisEz13 @joeyaiello Most of PowerShell commands in Command Line Rosetta Stone are not applicable to PowerShell Core.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I can not open the site in the latest IE version. 😕

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @TravisEz13 As @alexandair mentioned, some commands there don't work with PowerShell Core, like `Get-WmiObject` and `*-EventLog` commands, as well as `[Environment]::OSVersion`, which doesn't give the correct OS version.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I looked at CommandLine Rosetta stone... you can make changes, but I didn't look and see if you could add a new option.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I suggest postponing this change until they become relevant.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
@alexandair 'Most of' seems a little... surprising. Thanks @daxian-dbw for being more specific, I can update the document for the Powershell Core equivalents later today (or you can if you get there first).

@TravisEz13 Just edit https://github.com/certsimple/rosetta-stone/blob/master/rosetta-stone.md - the entire document is built from that.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Thanks, if you are going to do the edits.  Ping here and hopefully a few people can verify.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Please remove WIP from title when the feedback has been addressed.

comments.author: stale[bot]
comments.body: This PR has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had activity in the last 30 days. It will be closed if no further activity occurs within 10 days. Thank you for your contributions.

comments.author: stale[bot]
comments.body:
This PR has be automatically close because it is stale. If you wish to continue working on the PR, please first update the PR, then reopen it.
Thanks again for your contribution.
Community members are welcome to grab these works.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
Chasing this up, sorry about the delay but it's been hard finding docs on a few of the items. Summarising:

 - WMI commands removed and replaced with CIM https://github.com/certsimple/rosetta-stone

 - `Test-Connection` should be there in 6 but still seems to be missing, despite https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1146. Maybe waiting on a new release. Does nayone know?

 - With things like `Resolve-DnsName` in PowerShell 6 - after reading https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/whats-new/what-s-new-in-powershell-core-60?view=powershell-6#backwards-compatibility-with-windows-powershell, should I wait for the `DnsClient` and `NetTCPIP` module to be ported to Powershell 6? Will they be included in 6.1? or is there a better, cross platform solution we should promote instead?

Thanks.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body: @TravisEz13 if you could let me know what you think re: above I can make any/all necessary changes.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> `Test-Connection` should be there in 6 but still seems to be missing, despite #1146. Maybe waiting on a new release. Does anyone know?

The original `Test-Connection` implementation was removed in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/5277 to make way for @iSazonov's new implementation (PR #5328). However, the new `Test-Connection` didn't make in 6.0.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body: Thanks @daxian-dbw I'll leave `Test-Connection` in so it's updated when 6.1 is out. Do you (or @TravisEz13 ) know about `Resolve-DnsName` per my comment above?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @mikemaccana `Resolve-DnsName` is missing, at least on non-windows platforms.

title: WIP - Add README reference to Command Line Rosetta Stone
